name: Sigma Pi Alpha Sorority, Inc.
description:
Sigma Pi Alpha is a Chicanx/Latinx based Sorority. It was founded in the Spring of 1996 at the University of California,  Berkeley by nine women who saw the need to create a close network of Chicanx/Latinxs who want to make a difference in the community, starting with themselves. Sigma Pi Alpha addresses the academic, cultural, communal, and social needs of its members.
 
For ourselves, we are a sisterhood of academic and personal support, trust, and understanding. We base our work on our three pillars of Campus Involvement (includes Academics), Community Service, and Sisterhood. For our campus, we sponsor informative and social activities. We support our fellow Latinx and Multicultural Greek organizations and network with other campus resources and groups. For our community, our priority is to promote higher education through mentoring, tutoring, scholarships, and to support Chicanx/Latinx youth. Most importantly, we support Chicana/Latina youth and address many community issues. 
 
We uphold our following seven goals: 
1. To enhance Chicana/Latina heritage within the sorority.
2. To be involved within campus and our communities.
3. To promote higher education in future generations.
4. To address academics, sisterhood, and personal and individual needs.
5. To create a sisterhood in which we can communicate and express ourselves with trust and security.
6. To form a sisterhood where we can receive support and a commitment that will last a lifetime.
7. To follow a code of conduct representative to us as a sorority and as Chicana/Latina women.
summary: Sigma Pi Alpha Sorority, Inc. is a Chicana/Latina Sorority. It was founded on May 2nd, 1996 at Berkeley by nine women who saw the need to create a close network of Latinas who wanted to make a difference in their communities starting with themselves.
categoryNames: CalGreeks Multicultural Greek Council (MCGC) Fraternities & Sororities
